text:
When i set up a rewrite rule with a Query String condition, the query string gets copied over and appends to the target url which i don't want. How can I prevent it from happening?

Here is the rule.

RewriteCond %{QUERY_STRING} a=b [NC]
RewriteRule ^/rewrite/query/string http://www.website.com/ [R=301,L,NS,NC]

When i hit the source url, it fires the rewrite rule, but it adds the query string too. How do we prevent the quesry string from getting added to the target?

http://www.website.com/?a=b

I thought it was a bug with Apache, but, there might be an option to not let it happen. Sorry to log this in the bugs category.

Any help would greatly be appreciated.

Thanks
Mani

This is indeed no bug and should have tried in the user support forum instead of asking here. The following rewriterule will solve your problem:

RewriteCond %{QUERY_STRING} a=b [NC]
RewriteRule ^/rewrite/query/string http://www.website.com/? [R=301,L,NS,NC]
